edu.ncsu.csc216.garage.ui

Class UserDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • edu.ncsu.csc216.garage.ui.UserDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class UserDialog
extends javax.swing.JDialog
    Implements a special dialog box to ask for information on a new vehicle.
    Author:
    Jo Perry
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserDialog

        public UserDialog()
        Constructor. Sets up the dialog window

      • UserDialog

        public UserDialog(java.lang.String license,
                  java.lang.String owner,
                  int hybrid)
        Constructor, sets up the dialog window for Editing a vehicle
        Parameters:
        license - License of the vehicle passed in from GUI
        owner - Owner of the vehicle passed in from GUI
        hybrid - Int value of 1 for hybrid, 0 for regular car

                                  java.lang.String owner)
        Private method -- sets layouts, adds panels and widgets for Edit
        Parameters:
        license - License plate of the Vehicle to edit
        owner - Owner name of the Vehicle to edit

        owner - Owner name of the Vehicle to edit

      • getInput

        private Vehicle getInput()
                  throws BadVehicleInformationException
        Private method -- gets input from text fields
        Returns:
        Car created from the user's input
        Throws:
        BadVehicleInformationException - if a Car cannot be created from the given information

      • getNewVehicle

        public Vehicle getNewVehicle()
        Returns the most recent result from this dialog box
        Returns:
        most recently created vehicle (or null if none was created)
